etymology.description: semantic: 牛(牛) (niú, 'ox') + phonetic: 勿(勿) (wù, 'do not') = items related to oxen -> generic 'thing' or 'object'
etymology.interpretation: The character 物 evolved from the combination of an ox, a familiar and essential domestic animal, and 勿(勿) (wù), which serves as the phonetic component. This suggests a broad category of things concerning daily life and utility.

examples.chinese: 这个物引起了人们的注意(這個物引起了人們的注意)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège wù yǐnqǐ le rénmen de zhùyì.

examples.chinese: 古代的学者重视物理现象(古代的學者重視物理現象)，探讨物质的本原(探討物質的本原)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài de xuézhě zhòngshì wùlǐ xiànxiàng, tàntǎo wùzhì de běnyuán.
examples.english: Ancient scholars valued physical phenomena, exploring the essence of matter.

examples.chinese: 生活中的每种物都承载着记忆(生活中的每種物都承載著記憶)。
examples.pinyin: Shēnghuó zhōng de měi zhǒng wù dōu chéngzài zhe jìyì.
examples.english: Every object in life carries memories.
